image.altText: A hole in the brick wall of a hospital has been covered by a wooden panel.

props.synopsis: A new Royal Darwin Hospital would cost more than $1 billion to build, and likely take a decade or more to deliver. So who has the political bravery to commit?

title.children: Damage from Cyclone Fina exposes NT's need for new Darwin hospital

image.altText: A detention centre with green grass, outdoor play equipment and grey metal fencing.

props.synopsis: Two politicians allege NT children in youth detention are being moved from Alice Springs to Darwin without their families' knowledge.

title.children: Claims youth detainees in the NT being moved without families' knowledge

image.altText: The exterior of the NT Supreme Court.

props.synopsis: The jury in the trial of a Tiwi Islands man accused of murdering an international student in Darwin hears final arguments from the prosecution and the defence.

title.children: Man accused of student's murder acted in 'chillingly premeditated' way, court hears

image.altText: Map of Sunda and Sahul, with arrows showing potential migration routes.

props.synopsis: A new genetic study has found Indigenous Australians travelled over two distinct routes, and 100 kilometres of open water, to reach the ancient landmass that would become Australia 60,000 to 65,000 years ago.

title.children: DNA study provides 'almost perfect correlation' for first Australians' arrival

image.altText: A multi-storey office building behind a fence.

props.synopsis: A leaked internal memo shows the board of the NT's main legal aid service voted down a proposal to exempt children accused of crimes from sweeping service cuts.

title.children: Memo shows Legal Aid NT board rejected service cuts exemption for children

image.altText: Two young women and an older woman pose for the camera

props.synopsis: Nineteen-year-old Estella Jones lives with a disability in her hometown of Tennant Creek, where she loves baking brownies, singing karaoke and spending time with good friends.

title.children: What Amy and Estella want you to know about living with disability

image.altText: A young girl walks across granite rocks covered in orange algae by the beach.

props.synopsis: Twenty years ago, Cape Barren Island was handed back to its traditional owners. Today's children are proof of the life-changing power of that act.

title.children: From $50 rentals to burying the dead, this island governs itself

image.altText: murder victim Lilie James in a car wearing a yellow top smiles as she takes a selfie

props.synopsis: Experts on gendered violence have warned against the proliferation of everyday location sharing tools to control victim-survivors after NSW's top coroner found Paul Thijssen used them to track Lilie James before her murder.

title.children: Tools 'at tips of everybody's fingers' being abused by DV perpetrators

image.altText: A student at Charles Darwin University heads to a 2016 graduation ceremony.

props.synopsis: The saddest aspect of all this that a generation of boys may feel compelled to suppress the ordinary the joy of celebrating another's success.

title.children: The internet is resembling the first few pages of The Handmaid's Tale

image.altText: An 80-year-old woman looking straight into the camera.

props.synopsis: Decades on from Australia's forced adoption era, just two states have set up a redress scheme for the mothers who were harmed. Survivors are calling for South Australia to take similar action — warning time is running out.

title.children: Jo had her baby 'ripped away' at birth — she's one of thousands across Australia

image.altText: A drone shot of a triangular facility made up of grey flat buildings at the northern tip of an island.

props.synopsis: Google's plans for a data hub could drag this remote island from a digitally starved past into an AI-powered future. But are the locals ready?

title.children: What Google's superhighway plans mean for locals on Australian island

image.altText: A man looks griefstriken.

props.synopsis: Many of the people who managed to escape the Wang Fuk Court fires in Hong Kong believe the disaster could have been prevented, saying they had flagged safety concerns more than a year ago.

title.children: Hong Kong questions why 'so many people died' despite warnings

image.altText: Vladimir Putin

props.synopsis: Something has now been unleashed in Europe which is going to be hard to put back in the bottle.

title.children: Europe doesn't find the prospect of Russian aggression as funny as Putin does

image.altText: a severe storm cell sweeps over brisbane

props.synopsis: An ongoing heatwave along Australia's eastern seaboard will fuel further extreme weather this weekend, and its longevity is now breaking long standing records.

title.children: Hottest spring on record for east coast as dangerous weekend storms return

image.altText: Photo illustration shows a downward trending line chart with emissions from a fossil fuel plant and a forest on either side.

props.synopsis: Australia's emissions had the biggest drop ever this year outside the artificial kink in the curve during COVID-19 shutdowns, but there's still a lot of work to do.

title.children: Record drop for Australia's emissions. What's working and what isn't?

image.altText: Usman Khawaja leans back

props.synopsis: Under-pressure Australia opener Usman Khawaja is not swayed by the ICC's top rating for the pitch in the first Ashes Test in Perth, labelling it a "piece of shit" for the second straight year.

title.children: Usman Khawaja hammers Perth pitch after another bowling bloodbath

image.altText: A splitscreen graphic showing 50 in orange against a blue background beside another 50 in blue against an orange background

props.synopsis: Every question has only two options: one is right and the other is wrong. You have an even chance of guessing correctly each time.

title.children: It's the second edition of our 50/50 quiz, where every question gives you an even chance

image.altText: A young mum smiles wearing her daughter in a carry.

props.synopsis: When Ali Gossage gave birth a second time, she did not experience the constant joys of motherhood. Instead, she was sometimes filled with "terrifying" anger.

title.children: Mother urges others to reach out after terrifying postpartum 'blackout rage'

image.altText: Woman wearing blazer, yellow shirt and hair up sits with pen in hand at a desk with Aboriginal paintings behind her.

props.synopsis: For the family of Dunghutti teen Jai Wright, the guilty finding against police officer Benedict Bryant for dangerous driving occasioning Jai's death lifts a "weight off their shoulders". Legal experts say it's the first time a police officer has been convicted in relation to the death of a First Nations person in custody.

title.children: Hopes NSW court verdict might 'change the course of police accountability'

image.altText: A graphic showing multiple Qantas planes lined up along the tarmac at Melbourne Airport.

props.synopsis: A fire that forced the evacuation of Melbourne's Qantas domestic terminal on Friday night continues to be investigated.

title.children: Investigation continues into Melbourne Airport fire

image.altText: A collage of images including missing boy Gus Lamont.

props.synopsis: The disappearance of Gus Lamont is one of those events that have a seismic impact on public consciousness: they distress, disturb, upset and unsettle. This week six mine shafts were searched, providing no further clues in the case.

title.children: Gus has been gone for 63 days, and multiple searches have yielded no clues

image.altText: Zac Lomax of the Parramatta Eels walks with his head down while a teammate follows behind.

props.synopsis: Threats of long bans for prospective R360 players prompted "a handful" of them to withdraw from the rebel league, which now says it will launch in 2028 instead of next year.

title.children: R360 launch postponed for two years after 'handful of players' withdraw

image.altText: A piggy bank, a toy home and a magnifying glass laid on a piece of floorplan

props.synopsis: We asked three financial experts about the up-front and ongoing costs of buying a home and for their tips on how to prepare for home ownership.

title.children: Think you're ready to own a home? Here are the costs to consider

image.altText: Sydney Thunder player Sam Bates looks shocked at the end of a WBBL game.

props.synopsis: After rain falls for most of the Sydney Thunder's innings, umpires decide to call off their WBBL clash against the Strikers with Phoebe Litchfield one swing away from ending the game.

title.children: 'You can't do that': WBBL game called off with Thunder one swing from win

image.altText: A man with long black hair speaks while gesturing with his left arm to someone out of frame

props.synopsis: The family and political allies of Pakistan's former prime minister say they've not been allowed to visit him in prison for weeks but authorities say he is well.

title.children: 'Where is Imran Khan?': Son of former Pakistani PM calls for proof of life

image.altText: meat in a shop

props.synopsis: A year of lamb and sheep records in Australia's saleyards is pushing up retail prices.

title.children: Lamb prices in Aussie supermarkets on the rise ahead of Christmas

image.altText: A child and a woman wade through the water on a flooded street in Medan in North Sumatra in Indonesia.

props.synopsis: The death toll is expected to continue rising after a week of record-breaking rain, flash flooding and a "rare" tropical cyclone.

title.children: 'Rare' tropical cyclone thrashes South-East Asia killing hundreds

image.altText: A man in a khaki puffer jacket.

props.synopsis: It come as Kyiv battles to persuade US officials to defend Ukraine's interests in peace agreement talks with Russia expected to take place in the coming days.

title.children: Zelenskyy's chief of staff quits after anti-corruption agents raid home

image.altText: a man with grey hair and glasses speaks to reporters at a  press conference

props.synopsis: A Queensland government-ordered report on the use of puberty blockers and hormone therapies in the treatment of transgender adolescents is due on Sunday but might never be publicly released.

title.children: Queensland report on puberty blockers might not see the light of day

image.altText: A sign that reads "beach closed" next to a path leading down to a beach.

props.synopsis: A makeshift tourniquet may have made the difference between a shark attack on the NSW Mid North Coast this week claiming one life not two. The attack has put a spotlight on how fatalities may be prevented.

title.children: Shark attack highlights need for remote first aid kits, drone surveillance

image.altText: Former Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte

props.synopsis: The judge says it is "necessary" for the 80-year-old to remain in detention as the conditions proposed by his lawyers do not meet the conditions for parole.

title.children: ICC rejects plea to release Philippine ex-president Rodrigo Duterte

image.altText: Young blonde girl in an outcrop of rocks.

props.synopsis: Renowned Australian director Peter Weir gives a rare behind-the-scenes insight into what made Picnic at Hanging Rock such a memorable and enduring film.

title.children: How Peter Weir captured a 'golden glow' in Picnic at Hanging Rock

image.altText: A soccer player in green and gold runs arm outstretched and smiling

props.synopsis: A spectacular long range effort from Kyra Cooney-Cross has helped the Matildas to a dominant 5-0 win over New Zealand in Australia's penultimate game before hosting the Asian Cup in March.

title.children: Cooney-Cross nets another long range stunner as Matildas humble New Zealand

image.altText: Dressed in a dark suit and tie, Barnaby Joyce sits in a room, looking into camera with a serious expression.

props.synopsis: The MP's resignation from the Nationals surprised no one, but drew ire from members of the party. Those on the ground in his electorate have a more mixed view.

title.children: Barnaby Joyce's kingmaker says he left voters behind in 'act of treason'
